alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 4:21PM CDT until August 24 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Conecuh County in south central Alabama... Northern Monroe County in south central Alabama... Southeastern Wilcox County in south central Alabama... * Until 1030 PM CDT Wednesday. * At 421 PM CDT, Heavy thunderstorms continue to slowly move northward across northern Monroe and Conecuh Counties, moving northward into southern Wilcox County over the next half hour to an hour. These storms are producing torrential rainfall rates. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monroeville, Peterman, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Pine Apple, Turnbull, Pineville, Riley, Pine Orchard, Tunnel Springs, Ramah, Natchez, Scotland, Skinnerton, Nadawah, Fowler, Buena Vista, Chestnut, Burnt Corn and River Ridge. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
